Reviews.Title: “Nice facility away from the Strip”
Reviews.Author: wanderers303
Reviews.Content: A girlfriend and I flew to Vegas to meet up with family and have a low-key version of a Vegas getaway. We were able to meet up with the family (who were staying at the Paris) and come back to a peaceful hotel without the electronic whine of the slot machines or drunken club-goers. The hotel was very nice with island-themed decor that was done in a mostly classy -- not kitschy -- way, and very friendly staff. The room was somewhat small and simple, but clean (other than someone else's dirty sock that we found on the floor on night 2 -- yuck!), and we received a nice handwritten note from Rosa the housekeeper in response to a question we had about the phone (there are 2 lines in the room, FYI). The shuttle service to and from the airport was a great convenience. We only used the service to the Strip once since it only goes to the Tropicana or Mandalay Bay -- both at one end. We wondered why they didn't offer a drop-off/pick-up location at each end of the Strip, but you can't complain about free transportation. It was nice to take the long walk to our destination the *one* time, but we didn't feel comfortable doing that late at night. Luckily, a cab ride to and from the Strip was just $7-9, so we used that for all other times. The pool was absolutely lovely. Very small compared to the big resort pools, but so much more relaxing. There is a waterfall to drown out any background noise (there were often some kids in it having fun), and the chairs and tables are of high quality and very comfortable. Breakfast was decent for being free, but be sure to go prior to 9:30am, or face the rush of people trying to grab their bagel before the service ends.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel cancelled my reservation without my consent”
Reviews.Author: jpcrash
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for two night to arrive in Mid May. I booked the room in late 2011. I called today to cancel my reservation and the front desk employee said it was already cancelled. I asked for the cancellation number for my records just in case. This could have been a very bad situation to show up at the hotel and my reservation was cancelled by the hotel staff. This is why I always confirm the reservation before I go to the hotel, but in this situation, to cancel. In short, hotel cancelled my reservation without my permission, but I was cancelling my stay anyways, but could have been a really upsetting situation.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest Hampton Inns”
Reviews.Author: lebelgo
Reviews.Content: This place wasn't perfect, but all together it's one of the best Hampton Inns I've stayed in, and I've stayed in quite a few, perhaps dozens. I'll go over the few negatives first. The rooms are smaller than most Hampton Inns. I killed a cockroach on the first day, and it wasn't vacuumed up on the 2nd day (I stayed 3 nights), so I know they don't vacuum daily (OK by me as long as they vacuum between guests). The shuttle isn't very frequent (hourly on the hour only), and it's almost 3/4 mile to walk to the strip (1 mile to the MGM Monorail station as the crow flies, according to my i-phone GPS). Also, lots of helicopters fly overhead for reasons I never deduced (one staff member thought it might be people flying to Hoover Dam?). With these caveats in mind, this Hampton is a cut above most others. This place has far more space at breakfast than most others, so finding a place to sit down at breakfast would never be a problem (I'd think). The swimming pool is more attractive than most. It's probably good that it's shaded most of the day in the desert sun. The hot tub was closed while I was there. It did concern me a little that there was no work date set on the sign. I'll give the hotel the benefit of the doubt that this wasn't a weaselly way to make an indefinite closure. Everything else in the hotel was in good working order, including the gym and business center. I also give this place extra points for having a very functional internet connection. It was at least ten times faster than the connection at the Doubletree near the airport, where we spent one night before moving here. The clogged sink in our room was promptly fixed with one call. Even the paneled elevator was more attractive (and faster) than those of most other Hampton Inns. Usually when I go to Las Vegas, I prefer staying at a more upscale facility on the Strip. However, when we must go during a high-occupancy period (we--well, mostly my domestic partnter--were attending the very large National Association of Broadcasters convention), I would not hesitate to stay here again rather than spend over $250/night for similar digs on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Family Friendly, Nice Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: SDBeachbum
Reviews.Content: Lots of families. If you're looking for a romantic trip to LV, this is probably not the place. Plentiful free parking. Free WIFI. Very convenient to the strip (short drive) and UNLV. My only negative experience was when the police -- or should I say Old West posse -- pulled me over and gave me an unwarranted ticket right outside of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, but a bit crowded and noisy.”
Reviews.Author: Kd4dna
Reviews.Content: This being Las Vegas what was I expecting? The property is very clean and nicely decorated, the front desk staff was friendly and attentive. Rooms were as expected, we asked and had a refrigerator sent up to the room. Noise from the upstairs guests was a little annoying. Overall a nice place, but next time I'll bring my ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Comfortable, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: kgcolorado16
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights, enjoyed a suite and the bed was so comfortable, the suite was immaculate and the service was fantastic. Shuttle service was great, thank you Tony! Front desk staff was very friendly/helpful, kudos to Doug! Housekeeping was very friendly and helpful. LOVED being off the strip yet still close. Quiet & restfull and we enjoyed the free breakfast buffet each morning. Pool was nice and also the workout room. We really enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Odor issue, off the strip, not a nice area”
Reviews.Author: Aussiebw
Reviews.Content: I had some high expectations for this hotel due to it being off the strip and expecting great service. Our room was upgraded to a conference suite for some reason. The only thing this did was give us a 10 seat conference table. Not much use at all. The room smelled terrible, and my wife said it seemed to be a sewer odor coming from the bathroom. There is no room service, the complimentary breakfast was disgusting, and the location for this hotel is not even safe to walk around at night in my opinion. We were both disappointed with the bed. Not very comfortable at all. It pays to pick a quality hotel on the strip. One good thing I can say is we appreciated the shuttle service from the airport. that was great, and the driver was very accommodating. After 2 nights we ended up forfeiting our room for the remaining 2 nights and moved to a strip hotel. Huge difference...

Reviews.Title: “Flawless”
Reviews.Author: greenmonstah
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights while visiting Las Vegas. It is situated one black off the Strip, near the Exalibur and the Tropicana. They provide complimentary airport shuttle and will take you to and from the Tropicana. This made it super convenient for us, as we were able to be close to the strip, in a clean and comfy room, without having to walk through hoardes of tourists in the hotel lobby and making the long trek from the lobby to hotel room. No resort fees, free parking, free breakfast, free coffee, free internet. They even have their own bar in the lobby with Happy Hour specials. There is an In and Out Burger across the street, which my daughter loved. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very good!”
Reviews.Author: ricik
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Dec/11 ran very smooth. Frindely people at the reception. Nice people at the breakfast reception (small but was OK). We used the car everyday to go the strip. It worked just fine for us (couple with a 10 year old boy).

Reviews.Title: “We have groups of kids here every weekend”
Reviews.Author: empac99
Reviews.Content: We have made Hampton our 'go to lodging, staying at one or another from NYC to Ft. Lauderdale, and from Buena Park, CA to San Juan, PR. The rooms are nice, the service great, and even though it isn't the cheapest place to stay, the value for your dollar can't be topped. We recently stayed, we're still here as this moment, in LV on Tropicana's, west of I15. On our second night, the hotel was beset by 14-17 year-olds who yelled in the hallways, banged doors against the deadbolts they had set to keep them from closing, and ran up and down the halls. The few adults with the ones on our floor had as much effect on their behavior as swatting at flies. Now and then awe would hear attempts to restrain the kids, but within minutes the behavior would continue as before. When I called the desk on Thursday night, the woman taking my call asked what I suggested she do about the situation. The next day I was told there were similar groups in every part of the hotel, and there was no other room likely to be more quiet. I was later told "we have groups of kids every weekend." I don't blame kids for being kids, and my room was nice, but 1) I should have been told, as a Hilton Honor's member, at least, that I would be staying during the stay of such a group, and 2)) some portion of the hotel should have been saved by people who wanted to SLEEP at night. I wish someone had written this for me asmine was a working trip, and my efforts were almost worthless on this trip. I'll continue to stay at Hampton, but probably not on Tropicana in LV.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Linda S
Reviews.Content: As a person who travels for work and has been in many places, I would like to highly recommend this hotel for those travelling to the Las Vegas area for business or pleasure. This hotel is exceptionally clean, staff is friendly and helpful. Breakfast was great every day! Needs were anticipated and met. Travelling for work can get tedious, but staying here felt like being at home. The location is close to the action on the strip, yet off so if you need to focus on work activities those can be accomplished without difficulty. The hotel was quiet, my sleep was never interrupted. I spent 3 weeks at this hotel and I look forward to staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Free Shuttle & Happy Hour & Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Bob M
Reviews.Content: Great Inexpensive place to stay in Vegas. Rooms were clean, free shuttle to and from airport and a free happy hour with wine and beer. The staff was pleasant and very helpful. It's a little off the strip so you will need to do a little walking or take the shuttle. Put the hotel phone # in your cell and call for a pickup. The pickup location is actually a level below baggage claim and is a little tricky to find.

Reviews.Title: “Great meeting spot”
Reviews.Author: Rhonda S
Reviews.Content: We hosted a meeting fr 50 customers at this hotel. Having hosted meetings all over the country, I was very impressed with the staff, location and the food. Everyone was attentive and anticipated our every need. I would definitely recommend this location which was close to the strip, but far enough away to sleep well.

Reviews.Title: “A true gem off the strip”
Reviews.Author: itsnevercoldthere
Reviews.Content: We just happen to stumble across this hotel. Our flight was over sold and we took the voluntary bump. The airline provided us with some generous flight vouchers, meals, transportation, and (gasp) a room. We were a little worried since normally the airlines don't spring for a nice hotel. So, before we left, I did a little research on TripAdvisor. The reviews set my mind at ease. We called a number to the hotel and arrange the free shuttle they provided. The driver was there in litterly 10 minutes. Way quicker than I expected. This guy was a riot. He was an ex cop from New York. Very friendly and had some great conversation. Wish I had his name, but I can't recall. The ride to the hotel was quick. I would guess maybe 8 minutes. The hotel is close to the airport. It is located on Tropicana and Dean Martin, appoximately 1/2 mile from the strip. When we arrived, check in was quick and clerk was polite. We requested a non smoking and king bed. We were granted that request. The room was nice, modern, and clean. It was equipped with free wi-fi and a large flat screen tv. Shower was also nice and clean. They also provide a free shuttle to and from the strip. You just let them know and they will take you there. They drop you off at the Tropicana. The shuttle ride is about 2 minutes. You could walk to the strip in about 10 minutes. When you want to be picked up, you just call the hotel and they send the shuttle. They do pickups until 2 am. Service was always quick. We didn't have to wait long at all. Maybe 5-10 minutes. Check out was quick and easy. They had a nice, free, continental breakfast in the moring. We took the shuttle back to the airport. It runs every hour. Our flight left at 8:40 am. We took the 7 am shuttle and arrived with plenty of time. Here is what sets this hotel apart from others. When we arrived at the airport, I noticed my wallet and travel pouch was not in my bag. I started freaking out. There is no way I forgot it or lost it. I called the hotel to see if I dropped it in the morning when I was checking my emails in the lobby. No such luck. My throat was in my stomach. I had lost our newly recieved flight vouchers and wallet were gone. I thought what the heck, it's worth checking the room. They took my number and said they would check and call me back. I am thinking, "ya, I bet they call me back in an hour and can't find it". Litterly within five minutes they called and said they found both of them. They were sending the shuttle driver back with them. He was there in about 10 minutes. I couldn't believe it. Kudos to the entire stuff there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent non-casino hotel”
Reviews.Author: raop
Reviews.Content: Standard like all Hamptons...free internet and breakfast, free pick up from the airport. Walking distance from the beginning of the strip (near the MGM). However the path appears unsafe after sunset . Better to take the free hourly shuttle to the strip and get a cab ride back. One of the few Hamptons that has a bar. Nothing to complain about if you are looking for a value for money hotel that is quiet. Obviously it does not offer you the party scene of the casino hotels on the strip. The only thing to watch out for are the shuttle drivers. The guy who picked me up from the airport gave me information most of which was not accurate. The staff at the lobby are more friendly and willing to help..keep away from the shuttle drivers...

Reviews.Title: “Hampton Inn Tropicana Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ROBERT R
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for 17 days during a business trip. The General Mgr, Mr. Yair Eldar and his staff could not have been more gracious and accommodating. The entire facility was always clean and immaculate. And the breakfast was among the best I have encountered in all of my travels. All in all, this is the place to stay, without on-site gaming noise and distractions. It is just across the interstate, two minutes from the Las Vegas Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Good and cheap for quad sharing, only if you have a car”
Reviews.Author: cheechee_81
Reviews.Content: Went there at a busy weekend, hotel choices are limited for quad sharing, and extremely costly due to late booking. this is the hotel we settled in. If you dont drive, this is the worst location that you want to be, way off the strip. For us is ok since we drove. Room is good, and very clean. Wifi available in lobby area. and the jacuzzi is just nice beside the swimming pool (shared). not much to complain except the distance to the strip, but value in money for quad sharing option in a busy weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Strip - back far enough away to sleep!”
Reviews.Author: Irish_LassOttawa
Reviews.Content: The Hampton Inn Tropicana was an excellent choice for me because it offered a free breakfast and free shuttle service. Being away from the Vegas Strip (but still in close proximity) was also a deciding factor as to why I chose this hotel. Ninety-five percent of the staff was the epitome of class and professionalism. There was one younger front desk agent though (Stephanie), who talked down to me and decided that I was just someone she particularly didn't like (for what reason - I still don't know). Sadly, that one person will stay in my mind mainly because this was my Christmas holiday; but does not deter from the fact that everyone else (Arlene, John, Jay, Shonell (Front Desk) as well as John and Lupe (Shuttle drivers)) were fabulous to deal with, chat with and share with. It was like coming back home to family! I thank them for a lovely time.... It's easy enough to walk to the Strip during the daylight hours, but I would highly NOT recommend to walk around during the evening. It's best that John or Lupe take you somewhere in the shuttle and then call them when you need a ride back to the hotel. They are more than ready to accommodate and ensure your safety. This is a family hotel - so be prepared that there are little monsters that run up/down the hallways. One quick call to the front desk can change that too....after all, they aim to ensure that everyone is happy (even us with older kids!). Enjoy your stay. I did.....smiles!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel handy for the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Glenn_C
Reviews.Content: The Hampton Inn Tropicana is a comfortable little hotel very near to the Strip in Las Vegas on Dean Martin Drive. My wife and I enjoyed 8 days stay here in December 2011, attracted by its facilities and by the fact that it offers a wonderful breakfast every morning, which must be unique for Las Vegas. This breakfast included scrambled eggs, omelettes and sausages, as well as a selection of cereals, beverages, fruit and pastries. Our room was large and comfortable on the sixth floor, with a view of the Strip. The hotel offers wi-fi, a business centre with free internet access, a heated pool and fitness suite, hot drinks available 24 hours a day in the Coconut lounge, and a free hourly shuttle service to and from the airport as well as to and from the Strip. To be picked up after a day gambling, shopping or simply enjoying the sights you simply ring Reception and they send the bus to pick you up. I warmly recommend this comfortable hotel and its friendly staff and excellent facilities to all those tarvelling to Las Vegas, whether for leisure or business.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price !!”
Reviews.Author: debbie01498
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be amazing. The service before and during our stay was great.. very friendly staff. The rooms were a good size with flat screen tv and very clean. We had asked for a fridge and they delivered one to our room right after we arrived. The breakfast buffet was awsome... fully stocked with both hot and cold items, eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, make yourself waffles, hot & cold cereal, toast, bagels, muffins and juices. The dining area was very pleasant and clean. The distance to the strip was very short and within walking distance if you wanted to take a walk or they have a shuttle. We really liked the location of this hotel right off the interstate but very close to the strip. They had a beautiful pool however since our visit was in Nov it was closed. We had stayed at a very high end hotel on the strip our last visit and this hotel was much guest friendlier and much financially friendlier. We will definitely stay there on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: SecretBeer
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Honors member and travel extensively. However, my wife made this particular reservation being I was between trips. I usually frequent certain properties usually those I've previously visited or ones recommended. I was surprised at how pleasant my stay was here. listed below are the things that made my trip so pleasant: Location - Conveniently located walking distance from the MGM Grand, New York, Luxor, Excalibur and Tropicana Hotels. You can choose to use the free shuttle to MGM and/or Tropicana Hotels. This is suggested if you are traveling with kids as you will have to walk under a dark overpass when accessing the strip by foot. The shuttle drivers are friendly and will take you just about anywhere. ASK THEM! Breakfast Buffet - This one of the main reasons I frequent certain properties. I enjoyed the fresh fruit, yogurt types, hard and omelette style eggs, and juice station. I'm not big on carbs but there is quite a selection of cereals, waffle station and pastries. *The scrambled eggs remind me of boot camp with a powder taste... not happy about that one* All-in-all still plenty to choose from. Coconut Bar in lobby - The waitress is friendly and will immediately remember once she's met you. They provide a selection of munchies to Chase your beer. There are three large screen TVs that are perfect for Football fanatics like myself. And, the beers are off strip prices which I recommend starting at before the 7 dollar beers at the clubs and casions. Pool / Exercise Area - These are the only two things I could review negatively on. The pool deck is being refurbished which is no problem as they let you know on their website and at the front desk. I like the hot tub versus filling the room tub with water. The exercise room needs to be cleaned and the machines tuned. Both treadmill running pads are sticky and this can be dangerous for faster, heavier runners. Its too cold to run my daily 4 - 6 miles outside and would require the purchase of warmer clothes.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Hampton - GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: PANeddie
Reviews.Content: We booked a tour group into this hotel at the beginning of a 10-day "Southwest Safari" and at the end - 2 separate nights, 18 rooms each time. The staff bent over backwards to help us with any issues that arose. On the evaluation sheet that all of my 36 members were asked to fill out, everyone rated this hotel a "very good" or an "excellent". That should speak for itself. We specifically wanted to use this hotel for 4 reasons --- 1. It offers a free shuttle to and from the airport (which is only about 10 minutes away). 2. It's right on I-15, so our coach can get on the highway in about 2 minutes, and on out to the plateau. 3. It's a Hampton, so we knew that quality is a standard. 4. They offer a great, free (and hot) breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: rickemmerich
Reviews.Content: I actually thought this was the property behind the Trop Hotel/Casino. Wrong, it's ON Tropicana. They had a shuttle to the airport-although that became a slight setback. It took them a while to actually come and get us. Upon arrival we got a great room and the desk people were generous, giving us each a bottle of water for free. While we loved the room and the property, upon waking up and looking around I found an article of clothing left behind in back of the loveseat. After reporting that the management chose to give us that first nite free-nice touch. Meanwhile we were there for an event and everything went extremely well. We difinitely will stay there again. I got a great look at the pool and the relaxed seating out there and wished my wife and I had more time to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: David W
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night on our way through. The hotel was good value, clean rooms and a reasonable breakfast. Make sure you use the hotel shuttle over to the Tropicana on the Strip, it's easier than walking believe me.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive alternative for staying on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Sean J
Reviews.Content: If you have a rental car, and don't mind driving a few minutes, this hotel is a descent inexpensive alternative. The rate includes internet and an adequate breakfast. The rooms are ok, and have all the necessities

Reviews.Title: “Ok for family stay but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: robert_dfw
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property during a business trip to Las Vegas as it was booked by my client. I should know better than to accept what clients arrange! The property is fine and well kept but attracts a very family oriented crowd. It gets extremely noisy during the evening (excessive noise from the pool, running and screaming in the hallways, etc.). Complaints to the management mostly fall on deaf ears.

Reviews.Title: “Hampton Inn Tropicana is a good choice for staying off-the-strip Las Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: GorillaCousin
Reviews.Content: This is not a fancy Strip hotel, but it provides a high quality stay at very reasonable prices. Rooms are clean and quiet. The pool, lobby area, business center (with computer and internet connection) and self-serve laundry are maintained in excellent condition. The staff is very friendly and helpful. I would not call the location "scenic" and there is little or no food or shopping within walking distance, but a free shuttle is provided on the hour to take you to the Strip or the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good place away from strip”
Reviews.Author: ange1971
Reviews.Content: This place was a great overnight stop for us - we were travelling with a child so being away from the strip suited us perfectly. It was clean with free wifi and parking. The breakfast buffet was also very good with a large selection and fresh fruit on offer.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, short ride to strip, clean”
Reviews.Author: BluebirdSD
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, the room was not too noisy and the staff was helpful. It offers a shuttle to nearby hotels on the strip and a free breakfast. Yes the breakfast is chaotic (avoid the eggs!) but its passable. I would not recommend trying to walk to the strip from the hotel. It’s not far but the traffic on Dean Martian Dr is very busy and actually getting to the strip would be difficult. We ended up using the shuttle and then taking a cab back from The Venetian which cost $11 plus tip. The bathtub in room 205 could use some attention and needs to be thoroughly cleaned. Overall this is a good option to paying twice as much at one of the casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Best value hotel just off Strip”
Reviews.Author: CazMin
Reviews.Content: Stayed 10 nights in October with kids. Great value, wonderful staff, very clean, good gym, excellent safety deposit box system, very nice free breakfast (all other places to get breakfast are $10-40!!), free shuttles to 2 hotels and to and from airport, great pool, hot tub and cabanas, 10 mins or less walk to the strip, convenience store next door, burger place next door, near to airport and main hire car center. Free parking. Nice business center. Free Wifi in all hotel. Would definitely only go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for a fair price”
Reviews.Author: TravelForFunAndWork
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nicely decorated and very clean. The rooms are quite large. It is located about ten minutes walk from the Strip MGM Grand/New York New York/Excalibur Hotels. There is free parking. Good breakfast and a good pool area are also included. Check-In and -Out without any problems. There are also free shuttles available to the Strip as well as the airport which we did not use. We found the pricing very competitive especially with the third night free option.

Reviews.Title: “It'll do”
Reviews.Author: OregonSp8
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights on business, and suspect I could have gotten a better value elsewhere for the same price. The hotel is conveniently located near the strip, and although I didn't have the opportunity to use it, the pool looked nice. There is also a convenience store and fast food restaurants near by. My room was the smallest of all the Hamptons I've stayed, and more attention could be paid to cleanliness (hairs in shower, spots on pillow case, toilet not throughly cleaned, take out garbage in desk drawer). I was sure to wipe down surfaces with Clorox wipes and tried not to think about what the spots on the walls were. It wasn't the worst hotel I've stayed in, it'll do in a pinch, but I'll look for somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel Just off the strip”
Reviews.Author: Luvs2Travel2k11
Reviews.Content: Overall a good budget hotel, but hotel shows some signs of its age. Just off the strip but very easy to get to the strip. Pros 1) Free Breakfast: wide selection of hot and cold Cornflakes, cereal, juice: apple/cranberry/orange Fruit: apples/bananas/oranges/fruit salad Eggs (scrambled or omelets) / sausage or bacon /toast Coffee/Tea station Muffins/pastries Waffle machines (make your own) 2) Transport Free shuttle to and from the airport about 15-20 minutes. Free hourly drops and pickup to Tropicana Casino, about 5-10 minutes ,which is at the end of the strip and to Mandalay Bay. Last shuttle pickup from Tropicana is at 12:30am. Generally reliable (out of 7 days, only once did we call and have a long wait), different drivers, some more flexible than others. Walking: 15 minute walk to the Hotel from the Tropicana. We walked it on 2 days, but the sun is quite hot, so take an umbrella / hat. Bus Cross over to the New York New York and goto the bus stop on Tropicana Avenue Stop ID: 2813 Take the 201 Bus towards 201A Tropicana Westbound to the next stop Tropicana @ Dean Martin (W) Stop ID: 2804. Cross the road and then the Hampton inn is just after the gas station. 3) Pool Seemed decent, we did not use. 4) Internet Good connectivity in the rooms, as well as business center on ground floor. 5) Friendly staff 6) Good Laundry facilities for guest ( 2 washers/ dryers on the ground floor) Cons 1) When we got to our room the sink had some black spots, but we thought it was the design of the sink. Next morning the sink was clogged up. Spoke to hotel reception that changed our room and sent some one up to check the clogged sink while we were packing to move. I later went back to the room and checked and the guy had also scrubbed the sink, since most of the black spots were gone.Also the air con in this room was kinda of noisy. 2) We were moved to a second room on the same floor. We also got 1 night stay free. In the shower there are some pinkish lines which are suppose to be design elements (marbling I think), however it doesn’t really do anything for the décor. 3 of us were sharing a room with two double beds, and of 3 hotels we visited on our trip, these double beds seemed the smallest. 3) There was a convention a couple of days we stayed there and the breakfast staff was a bit overwhelmed with the increased numbers.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING INN! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!”
Reviews.Author: mrmanx
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived there was a minor issue that resulted from a misunderstanding on both parties. This was handled and resolved quickly and professionally by the manager. We opted for this hotel mostly in part due to the lack of slots and that gambling feel. That is what the Strip is for. The Strip is close by but is not recommended by walking due to a major highway you have to cross. The hotel offers a free shuttle to the Strip. We drove to the Excalibur parking lot in 5 minutes. The pool was refreshing and ideal in that it was not crowded. The free breakfast was as advertised: Spectacular! I was so impressed by our first visit/stay that I signed up for the HHONORS program. I look forward to a return stay.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME ROOM FOR THE PRICE!”
Reviews.Author: maistro13
Reviews.Content: So my friends and I stayed here for a weekend getaway and here's our take at the Hampton Inn. Who we are: Group of friends in our mid 20's who enjoy good ol fashion fun! Rooms: Amazing! Not the biggest, but definitely clean and a lot nicer than other hotels on the strip. The BED is probably the most comfortable bed I ever slept on. The rest of our group which had 9 people all agree as well. Continental Breakfast: Great! It's not gourmet but its great to have in the morning with friends. Food includes cereal, coffee, fruit etc. Pool: Nice, can get a little crowded but still really nice. Distance: You will need a car to get to the strip, but it's not far at all. Price: Awesome! We went on a weekend and everyone was happy with the amount we divided among each other. VERY reasonable. In conclusion, if you're looking to have fun in vegas on a budget, this room for the price is really worth it. The lobby downstairs is NICE and my friends and I had memorable moments here! Stay here if you don't mind driving to the strip. Thanks for reading my review! Hope it helps!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: anika w
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week during a convention at Mandelay Bay . We were impressed with how clean and well taken care of the property was. The staff were all top notch and all seemed to have great pride in their work. Very friendly and so happy to help in any way with a smile!The breakfast bar was great and the pool was quite luxurious feeling. We stayed at Mandelay Bay the last year and of course it was nice, but next year we will stay at this Hampton Inn again. I will look forward to it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location- great service-very clean-highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Dudnpep
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel to anyone ok with staying off the strip. They provide a very reliable shuttle service to and from the airport and the strip. The shuttle doesn't start until 5 am but we had to be at the airport at 4 am and they arranged to get a shuttle earlier!!! Their breakfast was wonderful and always full- their rooms are roomy. We had a view of the strip with mountains behind and it was beautiful. The staff was friendly- they had a nice fitness and business center. I'm from the Midwest so I get excited when I see an in and out burgers and it is across the street (very walkable). I will be back And I can't wait!!! Stay here --management does an awesome job--- I applaud them!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option close (but off) the strip”
Reviews.Author: Discus69
Reviews.Content: With have decided to stay there after ready all the negative reviews about the hotels of the strip. This was indeed a good decision: - free Wifi with good speed - free breakfast with fresh waffles and fruits - quiet - very friendly staff - the rooms are up to date (flat screen, etc ...) By car we could reach the strip within 5 min. Maybe not exceptional for a long stay, but very convinient for 1-2 days stay.

Reviews.Title: “Off- strip location is close but sketchy”
Reviews.Author: Mike W
Reviews.Content: This is a run-of-the-mill Hampton Inn. There is a bar in the lobby - that is the only notable exception. Room is adequate with nice big LCD and easily 5 different HBO channels. Wifi is good and fast. Pool is decent. Bathroom tub could use renovation - cracks in the fiberglass etc. Tub wouldn't drain. I complained and they fixed promptly. Staff is friendly and helpful. Gas station, Jack-in-the-box in the parking lot. In-and-Out across the street. Would not walk around after dark. About 1/2 mile to the strip. Hotel has van service.

Reviews.Title: “HAMPTON INN TROPICANA: WHAT A GREAT PLACE TO STAY!”
Reviews.Author: michelle c
Reviews.Content: I was in for business and was so grateful for the individual attention I received. The front desk saw that I was tired and offered me something to drink as well as assuring me that they would take good care of me. I had a very nice sized room that was perfectly air conditioned when I entered. It felt great. I went to the gym that was fully equipped and very clean. The Business Center was wonderful and very convenient. I really loved all the staff who said "hello" to be in the hallways and seemed to make an effort to make my stay enjoyable. I would highly recommend the hotel. Its individual attention and closeness to the Las Vegas Strip make it better than any other hotel I stayed at, especially for its reasonable price. DEFINITELY A GREAT PLACE TO STAY!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING staff, INCREDIBLE service.”
Reviews.Author: RichardMartinez2011
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the Hampton Inn Tropicana Las Vegas was spectacular!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: dynamite_deb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located off the strip which was ok with us since we had a rental car. We stayed here two nights and our room was great. We got lucky and had a room on the 1st floor. The room was on the small side but was perfect for us. Clean, nice linens and comfortable beds. We got a great AAA rate for a Friday and Saturday night stay. I was impressed with a card in our room telling us that the sheets and comforter were replaced daily. Sheets yes! The comforter or bedspread you can never be sure in most hotels how often they are changed. There was a nice loveseat with a foot stool. The bathroom had a marble counter. I felt like we were staying in a luxury hotel for a budget rate. We loved our room here. Nice lobby, bar and pool. We had an early flight home and it took us 7 minutes to get to the car rental facility. I noticed that they have a airport shuttle and a shuttle to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - No Las VegasTraffic or Lines”
Reviews.Author: lorenwebb
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel (great value) within walking distance of the strip (MGM Grand, New York New York, Tropicana, Excalibur) without any of the issues of the strip - traffic, and lines. Quick Check-in, updated rooms, friendly staff, nice pool and great free breakfast. Enjoy Vegas without any of the headaches.

Reviews.Title: “Not on Las Vegas Strip-poor location-disappointing”
Reviews.Author: malholme
Reviews.Content: Hotel is off Las Vegas Strip. Shuttle service only to Tropicana by reluctant driver. Have to return by taxi- can't get back to hotel on foot. Leaky plumbing. Worst hotel on our trip from San Francisco to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable for an overnight near the airport and strip.”
Reviews.Author: Flyinlow427vette
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights as a base for our plans in and around Vegas. This property is close to the strip, without being in the middle of the chaos. They have a parking garage and plenty of easy-to-access free parking. There is a gas station next door that is convenient to fill the car before returning to the airport. I am a Diamond Hilton Honors member, and I have come to expect great service at Hilton hotels. I was a little disappointed at this hotel's inability to meet a simple request. My wife needed to freeze an ice pack to keep medical supplies cold, and the hotel could not provide a micro-fridge or offer any solutions to freeze or cool an ice pack. The breakfast was typical Hampton Inn fare, which is to say a good selection and plenty of dining space. We aren't big pool goers, but the pool area is nice, with the exception that there isn't much shade. The water was surprisingly cool, despite the 100+ degree outside temperatures. There is a waterfall in the pool which undoubtedly causes additional cooling. The rooms do reflect the high occupancy this hotel experiences. The hotel rate was much cheaper than the typical casino on the strip, so I can't fault it entirely. I also stayed at the Pallazo on this trip and for half the price, I'd stay at the Hampton Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place. Very helpful employees. Good Airport transportation.”
Reviews.Author: Traindispatcher
Reviews.Content: Southwest Airlines put us up here because of a missed connection on our flight. It is not walking distance from the big casinos but they have a free shuttle that will take you to the airport and to the Tropicana.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GotuwanPankshin
Reviews.Content: The only down side were; No fridge or microwave in the rooms. Internet speed practically dail up. had to use my aircard during my stay. Overall, Nice hotel ad staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business hotel near the Strip”
Reviews.Author: rgbeard
Reviews.Content: Let's face it - when your co workers figure out you're going to Vegas to see a customer, you have an uphill battle to maintain credibility. If you book the MGM, Paris or another popular strip hotel, even if the price is right, your expense report is about to hit a new level of scrutiny. The Hampton solves this. It's a normal "business" hotel from the perspective of your company's beancounters, yet it's near enough to the strip to keep you close to the fun of Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to celebrate 21st birthday with Pleasant Surprises”
Reviews.Author: keoweegirl
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 arrived on a Wed. at approx. 9:00 am asked to have luggage held and Surprise #1 our room was ready to check in! Upon Checkout we asked for late checkout Surprise #2 We got late checkout for 4pm. Could be a goldmember perk along with.... Surprise #3 Gift basket in both adjoining rooms with goodies, and bar drink coupon... Surprise #3 Lobby bar with daily drink specials can even take drinks to enjoy @ pool... Surprise #4 Waterfall pool with comfy Chaises,..... never busy... if you get thirsty........ Surprise #5 Free Lemon Ice water in lobby Very refreshing after day walking the strip Surprise #6 Free Shuttle TO and FROM the strip with an hourly dependable schedule..... Surprise #7 One time unavailable to pick us up. Taxi back to hotel was comped

Reviews.Title: “1st Class hotel”
Reviews.Author: ianleask
Reviews.Content: from the minute you get on board the free shuttle bus till the moment you depart you know you have made the right choice.every member of staff makes you feel welcome. Nothing seems to be a problem. the suite we had was wonderful,spaciousand comfortable. the reception staff were welcoming and freindly and very informative on the area. The strip is only a short 7 minute walk. or a 2 minute trip on the free shuttle every hour on the hour. the free buisness centre offers computers for customers use. handy for flight check in or keeping in touch.I could go on and on but just choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money hotel with good service”
Reviews.Author: TheCraigs1984
Reviews.Content: Rooms are nothing spectacular but clean and spacious. Really good value for money hotel. Good choice of continental breakfast. Nice pool area and free shuttle service to the strip and the airport which is a huge benefit. No casino in hotel so quiet but strip within easy reach via shuttle. Shops and fast food outlets next door. Good views of the strip from rooms at the front of the hotel. Good friendly service from hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Hit and miss - will do in a pinch...”
Reviews.Author: Travelin_Man069
Reviews.Content: This Hampton seems hit and miss to me and several things just made my stay fall short. Started with at least a 15 minute wait to check in after a long work day - I was litterally standing in line in the breezeway. Secondly after the wait I wasn't even offered so much as bottled water (as a Gold Member this is usually pretty standard - just sayin') Third - I was directed to an elevator that is out of service - two days later it's still out of service and I have to walk half way around my floor to get to it. Old TVS with a pretty limited channel selection for these days - even in the bar area. Lastly no WIFI? It's 2011 for goodness sake. I just booked the Staybridge down the street for my remaining two days and will check out in the morning - I stay in Vegas quite a bit and this Hampton is close to my work - it may do in a pinch, but this stay definitely put it a few choices back on my list...

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not as good as advertised”
Reviews.Author: Docendee
Reviews.Content: Nice place – just off the Strip, close enough but out of the crazy traffic and without the smoke and maze of trying to check into one of the big name casino/hotels. Room was very clean, beds very comfortable, and, after about 11 pm when the noise from the airport stopped, very quiet (oh, heater was a bit loud). One plus – when my daughter and I came into our room the smoke alarm was beeping to say it had a low battery – we found a young cleaning lady and reported it, and within minutes we had maintenance fixing the problem – the guy even refused a tip! Beware! The price of the hotel is for ONE guest. We had to pay an "extra guest" fee for my daughter -- in a room with two double beds that already had a higher price than the king or queen single bed room!. Felt like a rip-off. One minus–the hotel site advertised free internet. This may be so, but only on the two computers in the “business center.” We had a non-functional wireless router in our room, and were informed that there was no access to the net in any of the rooms. We tried taking our laptop downstairs, where the front desk finally got us into their network, the connection dropped in less than 5 minutes. We had counted on being able to look up activities and directions, so this was a disappointment. Get breakfast early – the food selection is decent, but the place is badly laid out, so people trip over one another trying to squeeze past one another. We discovered that the hotel was hosting a number of high-school basketball players in town for tournament play, the young men were very polite but it was nearly impossible to get food around them.

Reviews.Title: “We will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: woodman38
Reviews.Content: Very freindly staff. Free shuttle to and from the airport, saved us alot of money. The breakfast was great. Very private and quite. It was nice to be away from the strip, yet still close enough to everything. Thanks for the hospitallity.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: danae777
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great value and I would definitely stay here again! Complementary shuttle pick up to and from airport was great, as well as the drop off on the strip! They take you right to the Tropicana, but can stop elsewhere if asked also. Rooms were clean, internet was okay as it was wired, but sufficient enough! Especially because we weren't there to work, perfect for checking emails. The complementary breakfast was also awesome. They had your standard fair of muffins, pastries, bagels, toast, cereal, juice and milk, but they also offered eggs and a meat every morning, sometimes scrambled and bacon, sometimes omelets and ham! The waffles were also good as well! Pool was nice, it was a little chilly outside for Las Vegas (62 degrees) but that was fine for us! It was 35 in Chicago back home! We had the pool and jacuzzi all to ourselves and it was really very nice. Close to quick eats like McDonalds, Wendy's, Jack in the Box and In -n-out burger, and also only about a 15 minute walk to the strip. VERY CONVENIENT! I would highly recommend this place to anyone because it was such a great value!

Reviews.Title: “Close to the strip, but a calm reprieve from that hustle-bustle area”
Reviews.Author: 4travel2011
Reviews.Content: Staff very helpful on the phone and in person. We appreciated the free shuttle service to and from the airport. The hotel is about a 15 minute walk from the strip (Tropicana Street comes in at the corner where NY NY hotel is), and they also have a shuttle service to the strip. The room was clean and comfortable with plenty of space, and must have good sound insulation because it wasn't noisy at all even though it seemed to be fully booked. When we walked through some of the huge hotels on the strip I noticed the long lines of people waiting for the reception desk to get checked in , and long lines in front of those hotels waiting for taxis, and I was extra glad we chose the Hampton Inn. Being a mid-sized hotel, registration was quick and easy--no waiting. No need for a taxi because of the shuttle service. I certainly would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet”
Reviews.Author: akide
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, don't let this older property scare you away. Had a great stay, free internet was provided via the hard-wired data port. Check-in was a breeze, hallways looks a bit dated but the room was fine. Nice quiet stay, couldn't hear any of our neighbours, nor any airplanes taking off or landing. A great plus to this location is that it's located directly across from In-N-Out Burger! Great place for a quick snack!! Clean room, and the free breakfast that is included on the main floor was satisfying. Would definately recommend if you're staying with the family, as they have a nice outdoor pool. Free parking, free shuttle drop off to New York New York was a great service provided by the property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - good location”
Reviews.Author: bk_t1
Reviews.Content: First, this Hampton Inn is similar to others, so my expectations on the property were met. The room was fairly quiet despite being near the highway. The location from the Strip is a bit of a walk over the hwy overpass (15-20 min, 1/2 mile or so). But, if you want value and you're a Hilton Honors member, it may work for you. Other ++'s...In-N-Out Burger on the corner, and other smaller casinos and fast food restaurants nearby, too. Airport shuttle runs on-call from the airport and on top of every hour to the airport. The same shuttle will stop at the Strip (NYNY) on the way to the airport - but no return ride. 2 tiny issues: They lost internet access on my first day when I wanted to work a little, and one of their business center printers wasn't working.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Vegas!!!”
Reviews.Author: ray_chavez
Reviews.Content: We promised Lena we would be back to stay on our next trip from Albuquerque, and thats exactly what we did. We drove out on Christmas day, planning to stay a few days, but the rates were UNBEATABLE! so we stayed on through New Years day. We love that you can actually see your car and it does not take a half hour to go outside. There are no casinos to walk through, no escalators. They have a gorgeous bar and swimming pool is awesome!! We will without a doubt stay there again. Thanks again Lena and Malia. Ray and Kathie

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: RussellBLasVegas_NV
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel in late December and again in early January for a total of six nights, first for an interview and later while I searched for an apartment. The rooms were very nice and clean; the complimentary breakfasts were excellent, with a wide choice of food, the location was perfect, but the most impressive aspect of my stay was the desk staff. They were outstanding: helpful, courteous, knowledgeable and efficient. Susan and Bruce, the evening staff were exceptional. Not only did they do their jobs well, but they seemed genuinely concerned about me, and asked about my interview and apartment search. It actually seemed like they cared about me, a stranger trying to find my way in a strange new city. Bruce was especially knowledgeable, offering up all kinds of useful information. Susan was terrific, too, and Lena, the morning clerk, was very helpful in getting my credit card hold removed quickly and checking me out. Quiet frankly, I am a fairly critical person, and the ONLY thing I can complain about is... the shuttle van will take you to the Strip but not pick you up. I highly recommend the Hampton Inn Tropicana to anyone visiting Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised...”
Reviews.Author: gnagel
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by this Hampton Inn. My room was modern, large and clean. I had some difficult at first connecting to the internet. So, I called the front desk and they said that a technician would come to the room immediately to resolve the problem. WIthin two minutes, the techinician arrived--and he had the internet up and running in no time! Great service! The breakfast was also better than I expected. The location was OK...just a few blocks west of the Strip. But, it's not very easy walking from the hotel to the Strip as you need to walk over the I-15 bypass. So, I ended up driving to one of the many free self-parking lots at the hotels when I wanted to go to the hotels on Las Vegas Boulevard. Overall, I was very pleased with my visit.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the middle of the city”
Reviews.Author: PANeddie
Reviews.Content: This hotel provided almost everything we needed. Our requirements: quality lodging (Hamptons are known for CONSISTENT high quality), free airport shuttle, excellent free breakfast, and easy access to I-15. We were not in Vegas to gamble, but to use it as a start/stop point for touring on the Colorado Plateau and the Grand Circle. The only drawback, in my view, is that there are no quality restaurants in the immediate vicinity --- I mean, like next door, walking distance. Otherwise, this hotel is FANTASTIC!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Less Cost!”
Reviews.Author: BrownTruckGuy
Reviews.Content: I have been to Las Vegas many times and most of the time when I am there for pleasure, I stay on the strip. Since I have been going there on business, at least 10 times in the past 4 months, I have booked the Hampton Inn Tropicana because it is one of the preferred hotels that my company allows us to stay. I was pleasantly suprised of the quality of the hotel for the price and it did not smell like smoke! The service was great, especially "Susan" at the front desk. One time during my many stays, I was given a room that I did not like. I went back down to the front desk and "Susan" accomodated me with an acceptable room without blinking an eye and without question. Her friendly service is one of the many reasons why we come back to this hotel for our home away from home, even though we have other options in Las Vegas. You do not get this friendly service on the more expensive "strip" hotels. The breakfast that is served in the morning is excellent and the waffles are to die for. I loved them so much, I went a bought a professional waffle maker for home. Just make sure you go down prior to 10:00am to eat. For the price, this is the best hotel in Las Vegas when you consider cleanliness, service & quality. Furthermore, the strip is merely a short shuttle away. Oh, by the way, the hotel provides the shuttle too...free of charge. I would stay here even if it was a pleasure trip and not business. Thank you Hampton Inn & thank you Susan!

Reviews.Title: “Don't book at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Susan S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an older non casino hotel, which wasn't a problem because we only needed it for one night and then we were booking into the Aria on the strip. The Hampton Inn is located on the West side of Vegas and is not on the strip, but a cab ride would only cost about 15 bucks. The problem was the bed bugs in the first room we were given. The second room didn't appear to have them, but we didn't unpack anything and we slept in our clothes and didn't use the shower at all. We just waited until we checked into the Aria the next day. They didn't offer us anything for our troubles and when we came down for breakfast it was all cleaned up by 10. I would not book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “AS WITH MOST HAMPTONS, THIS IS A GREAT PLACE TO STAY FOR A GREAT PRICE”
Reviews.Author: joenibley
Reviews.Content: The customer service is great and freindly. Lena at the front desk was especially welcoming and helpful. The hotel isn't on the strip, but it's only a block away. It's nice in that its a lot more calm than the hotels on the strip, which is perfect for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: JIL_22
Reviews.Content: Friendly and HELPFUL staff. Clean, QUITE room. Great breakfast. Free shuttle to the airport and the strip. Nice pool. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Think of the Children”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Weston
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn when a flight was delayed and a connecting flight could not be made. Overall, we liked the hotel. The lobby was bright and spacious. A free full breakfast was provided, and though the food was not the tastiest, it was, well, free and abundant. We especially enjoyed the pool and hot tub: they were clean, of a good size and the whole pool area was pleasing to the eyes (better than the pool at Paris, frankly). For whatever reason, at about 9 pm we had the pool and hot tub to ourselves. The room was adequate, which is to say, it was a typical hotel/motel room: two queen beds, desk, desk chair and chair, and television. The room was clean, but showing its age. Our view out of the small window was of a parking garage. We did not have to pay for the room (it was paid for by the airline), but we understood that the cost was $69 a night. If so, you can find deals for bigger, better rooms right on the Strip. For me, the walk from the Inn to the Strip (the closest casino/hotels are the Excalibur and New York New York) was less than ten minutes. However, I would not walk to the Strip at night, and the walk along the unshaded highway during the day when temperatures were over 40 degrees celcius was not pleasant. The Inn has no casino, but the Day's Inn a few minutes' walk away does. Like most "locals' " casinos, the slots were looser there than on the Strip or Downtown. The Orleans and its huge casino are about a ten minute walk away also, but my comments about the walk to the Strip apply here too (at least two adult superstores along the route, though, for your shopping pleasure). We noticed that most of the other guests seemed to be Europeans, many with teenagers. I can understand why: the Hampton Inn is a clean hotel with a great pool and no casino, perfect for families with kids. Would I stay there again? Yes, but only if I could not find a much better room deal mid- Strip (which these days is hard to imagine).

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: canadian-eh777
Reviews.Content: Just off the strip but you will need a car or taxi. There was a free shuttle bus. Rooms and bathroom was clean and modern. The pool area was very nice with a waterfall and hot tub. The breakfast was extensive. Free Internet too!

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: zeczeczec
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hampton Inn after a flight delay. I wish I had stayed there my entire trip. Clean rooms, good service, nice free breakfast buffet, even a laundry room so we could wash some clothes. Nice pool, uncrowded. decent location. It was far superior to the mid range casino on the strip we stayed at and there wasn't any hidden resort fee attached like there is now on the strip. Next time I am in Vegas I would happily stay at the Hampton Flamingo.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service but great rooms”
Reviews.Author: dbcme
Reviews.Content: The good: The hotel is clean and comfortable. The bed was quite enjoyable, with fresh linens and acceptable toiletries in the bathroom. The tub was a bit worn with cracks that had been resealed, but a bit sloppy. The so - so: The location is OK. It's not generally walkable to the main strip. I think the location is meant to accommodate passengers who need to stay at a hotel near the airport for whatever reason. I would only recommend staying here if you needed to be closeby the airport. CAUTION. The complimentary shuttle has big restrictions for early morning departures. They really got us on this one. If you have an early morning flight (ie: 6am) the hotel has a shady and cheap way of handling guests transportation to the airport. For this reason, I would not recommend this hotel if you are a business or leisure traveler and have an early morning flight out the next day. The bad: Susan. Just Susan. Front desk. Front the moment a group of us coming in off the shuttle bus walked in, she had a chip on her shoulder. She was called in from the back room by another employee (is this why she was upset?) to help the crowd, and was short, snippy and unprofessional to at least two of us. In contrast, the other employee was sweet, personable and welcoming to guests. It was an alarming contrast hearing the two huge differences in staff personalities. When I had to come back downstairs to ask for some toothpaste, she walked into the backroom and handed it to me - no words exchanged. Overall, I felt she had no business being in the service industry. This left me with an unfavorable impression of the property. Further, I had no response from the property manger since my initial inquiry. In summary, the hotel is not bad. Infact, it is pretty good, with just one rotten apple unfortunately working the front-line interacting with guests.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service, beautiful rooms, what more could you want?”
Reviews.Author: man2010
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this hotel are beautiful: spacious, clean, and with very comfortable beds. The hotel also has a very nice pool area and whirlpool. But here's what really stands out: the service was fantastic! The front desk staff provided amazing assistance with reservations, billing, directions to nearby locations, and they always did it with a smile. Special mention should be made of Lena, Maliah, and John, who were all very attentive and helpful. The hotel is located a bit off the Las Vegas Strip, but they provide shuttle service there, as well as to and from the airport. Also, you can take a cab from the hotel to the Strip for about $5. All in all, a great value, and a very comfortable and friendly place to stay. What more could you want?

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable bed and great service”
Reviews.Author: dacok
Reviews.Content: We ended up here out of necessity--not choice--when our airline gave us a voucher for failing to get us home when we were scheduled. We had been staying at a 4 star hotel on the strip the rest of our stay. The bed and bedding was more comfortable at this Hampton Inn, and the air conditioner cooled the room better. Also, the free breakfast (which was very good) and the free shuttle to and from the airport (and also to the strip) were nice additions. The room was clean, and the service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: gkottke
Reviews.Content: You know, people tend to use these spaces mostly to complain, thought I'd chime in with a brief review of my six day stay here. Lena on check in, supported by Malia, top drawer. Janet and her associate in the breakfast area worked hard...there were a couple times it was smoking busy and they did a nice job restocking and staying friendly, even though customers can be brutal...(clean up after yourselves people...) and lastly Tony on the shuttle is an ambassador...guy should own the place...like the idea it takes 30 seconds to get to a nice pool that is almost all your own...Lastly, it isn't luck, I've stayed here before...similar experiences...

Reviews.Title: “Old and Tired”
Reviews.Author: mauimadness
Reviews.Content: After a wonderful experience at the Kingman Hampton Suites, decided to stay here. Big mistake. The hotel is old and tired. The room was crowded with two double beds and the A/C rattled and whooshed all night. Staff happily changed the room for the second night and was much better however the A/C's are old and loud. Some staff were great others not so. Rooms were clean but small. The business centre's stamp machine was out of stamps and when staff was informed they said they'd have to phone the supplier, not helpful for another solution. The breakfast plates were styrofoam and pretty nasty! Given the exceptional deals on room rates in LV right now this was a disappointment. Needs an overhaul.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Steph3366
Reviews.Content: On our east to west, cross country road trip we have stayed and met many interesting people. By far Leena, at the Hampton Inn Tropicana, has been the friendliest and most helpful person we have encountered! Thanks so much for making our day!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place when you need to work in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: 2manyTradeShows
Reviews.Content: Third visit in 18 months. In a dumpy, industrial corner on the west side of Interstate 15, this hotel provides a great base when I have to work trade shows that are located in less glamorous venues with business-unfriendly rooms. Rooms are small but Hampton consistent, with good desk/chair combo and decent appointments. Only annoyance is that the wall-unit air conditioner is right next to the desk. Staff is competent and helpful. Parking lot is a little sketchy late at night/early in morning.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: terport
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great alternative for business in Las Vegas. The hotel staff is excellent. They go above and beyond to make you feel you are a valued guest. From the front desk staff to the shuttle drivers they are friendly and ready to help. It is a small hotel, great for a small group that would get "lost" at the larger Vegas hotels. If you are looking for a small, comfortable, friendly hotel the Hampton Tropicana should be at the top of your list.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel but poor internet service!”
Reviews.Author: laxsgirl
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my family last Dec. for business. We stayed in this hotel because of a class that was being held at the hotel. I came along & did some work from my room. The wireless internet was down almost our whole stay! It was very inconvenient for our company. We had no way of communicating to our clients back home. In the end though, the hotel compensated us for our room charges.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: AllieInCali
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Father's Day weekend. Requested specific room location and was not disappointed. Front desk staff member Bruce was more than pleasant and honored our request immediately. Fridge was in our room before we were! FYI- Not all rooms have refrigerators so if you want one, be sure to request it with your reservation. The hotel is not "on the Strip" but the view was nice. Also, since it isn't on the Strip, you don't have the bright lights keeping you awake- if you like to sleep with the drapes open like we do so we can wake up to the sunrise. Room was very spacious and we turned thecurved couch around to enjoy the view. Breakfast was as expected: three hot items, waffles, various breads and cereals, fruit, juice, coffee. A nice way to start the day. The pool is way cool. Has a waterfall, thick-cushioned chaise lounges, and surrounded by palm trees. Very relaxing. The tropical themed carpet and decor make this a "gem" of a find. Again, don't expect the Strip, which is at least a 10-15 minute walk, but they do offer a one-way shuttle to nearby resorts where you can ride the monorail all day for one price. You can always catch a cab back- or walk. It is Vegas after all.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed my stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: lniemiller
Reviews.Content: It was my first trip to Vegas and I stayed at your hotel, I was impressed with the room and the service, Lena at the front desk was very nice as well as the housekeeping department. The complimentary breakfast was very impressive with a wide variety to please even the most picky!! Any time I am in Vegas I will only stay at the Hampton Inn Tropicana!!!!! Thanks again for your wonderful customer service. It is truely a hidden gem!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we needed!!”
Reviews.Author: Davidgabou
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night on our way home. Room very clean, friendly staff. Breakfast was good. Short walk to the strip. Hello to Lena who was very helpfull and friendly. Thanks David and chris

Reviews.Title: “Lena, the perfect check in”
Reviews.Author: macwashere
Reviews.Content: My job requires me to travel every week of the year for the past nine years. I fly out Monday, and I am away from my home all week. I have never thought of myself as a particularly picky traveler, but I guess over the years I have become a bit more demanding than what I used to be. A job that requires so much travel certainly requires one to be patient and understanding, but it makes that endeavor much more attainable when you meet someone that is truly concerned with your needs. Such is the case with Lena. I left my house at 3am to catch an early flight to Las Vegas Nevada, and with plane delays, by the time I got to the hotel, I already had a 14 hour day, and looking forward to several more hours of work on my lap top before I could unwind. I have stayed at this hotel many times over the last year, and every time I walk through the front door of the Hampton Inn Tropicana, there is Lena with a smile on her face, and greets me by name. I know it seems a small thing to be courteous, but with Mondays like mine, it means a great deal. She stands there all day doing her job, being the first impression of this hotel to weary travelers like myself, and she does so without a hint of insincerity. I believe that’s because she truly is sincere, and that does make a difference when choosing a hotel. So thank you Lena, and thanks to the other fine folks at the Hampton Inn Tropicana, you all make my Mondays more bearable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Non-casino hotel at a reasonable price with great service”
Reviews.Author: Monmixer
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place to stay in Vegas, that's not a casin, but still close to the action this isnthe place to stay. The staff are friendly, and helpful. The rooms are nice, clean and quite. There is even a bar at this Hampton! One of the few in the country. You can't go wrong

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us!”
Reviews.Author: sillybroad
Reviews.Content: We drive into Vegas quite a bit and opted not to stay at a casino hotel this time - great choice! The rooms at the Hampton Inn are very clean, the beds are very, very comfortable, the pool isn't across the "casino floor" and for us the location is perfect...I really liked it! Prior we'd stayed at the Luxor and the Hampton's room had much more to offer, comparing standard rooms. We will absolutely come back here again!!! Plus we love In-N-Out right across the way! :)

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: JulianHJ
Reviews.Content: We'd stayed in Vegas a couple of times before at Central Strip hotels like the Wynn, Signature and Westin - this time we were just using Vegas as a starting point and had no intention of visiting the Strip. We looked around for decent places near the airport for a one night stay, the main criteria being reasonable cost and nice looking rooms. The Hampton Inn Tropica has certain met our expectations. The staff are very helpful and friendly, the location is excellent and the cost fairly reasonable ($87 for a king-size). The bed was very comfortable and I'm sure we would have slept a lot longer if it weren't for our disrupted body clocks. Breakfast was pretty nice, but limited. There was a scrambled egg mixed with turkey and ham, plus sausages. A variety of eggs would have been preferable. The self-serve waffle machines were excellent, an quite good fun (simple things, eh?). The communal seating arrangement might be inconvenient at peak times, but we were there very early and had no issues. We popped over to In-N-Out Burger, literally across the street, for dinner. It's HIGHLY recommended for fantastic burgers at great prices. Just what we needed after a long flight, having been awake for nearly 24 hours! There is a handy gas station and a couple of other fast food restaurants (Wendy's and Jack In The Box) a stone's throw away as well. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A decent place to stay in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Kansascloud
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights. It is a well run inn and was extremely busy during my Friday/Saturday stay. It seemed like a lot of school sports teams were staying here? Overall I certainly would not say that this is the finest Hampton Inn that I have ever stayed in. But...typical for a Hampton, it has a good bed and the rooms are quiet. (A/C is a littly noisy) It is a little worn in places but I think this place stays real busy so it takes a beating. The front desk staff was exceptional. Very friendly and efficient. I'd stay again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Zenyam
Reviews.Content: Last minute reservations over Valentine weekend. Staying for a soccer tournament. Service was fantastic! Fast and friendly service. Clean and comfortable rooms. Great free breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “very good and still striving to improve”
Reviews.Author: paboulder
Reviews.Content: Four nights in a quiet, clean room, fine bed, easy access to the strip, rest of Vegas. Hampton makes an effort to make up for the deficiencies of its neighborhood, which features gas and fast food and creepy people walking the street at night. It serves a full breakfast, including fresh citrus, yogurt, quality coffee, omelettes. A rarity: front desk staff (Malia) who knows the public transit system. I parked my car for 5 days and rode the excellent LV transit system. The unpleasant trip (trafficky) to the strip replaced by the #201 bus, going and coming to almost the Hampton front door, and the Deuce from the foot of the strip to all of Vegas, including the well-stocked Whole Foods Market in Town Square. High speed cable and wireless Internet access and a laundry and pool. Did I mention that the room was quiet?

Reviews.Title: “Love it except for the one way shuttle!”
Reviews.Author: LSiliga
Reviews.Content: I really love Hampton Inn. You always know what you're going to get: comfortable beds, really clean room, breakfast, fast check in, and this Hampton was no exception to the rule. My husband and I are staying here with our 4 year old daughter and it's great. No casino, low on the noise, free parking, free internet, has a laundry room and work out room, all included in the cost. The only thing I am disappointed in is the shuttle. When I booked the room I asked if they had a shuttle to the strip, the agent said yes... but didn't tell me it is a one way shuttle. They will drop you off , but there is no shuttle back. What in the world?? Really? It's not a long walk to the strip but it is under the freeway and described by the front desk agent as desolate and not safe for me and my 4 year old to do by ourselves. It's just laughable!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy beds, great service, and good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: tarasue666
Reviews.Content: This hotel is off of the strip, but a quick drive to it. It is one of the few Hampton Inns that has a bar, but I did not notice any gaming machines (when I stay in Las Vegas, I enjoy hotels without smoke and gambling, as I will eventually end up in a casino but don't need the temptation of slot machines every time I go to my car). I enjoyed our room - super comfortable bed, plenty of space, the only issue I had was the loud air conditioner unit which blows the curtains around. Despite this, I slept like a champ and would definitely return to the hotel. My trip was one night only, as I was in Las Vegas to have my hair and makeup done for a wedding. I booked the hotel on the Hampton website, and requested a late check out for this purpose. The front desk clerk was very friendly, and mentioned the upcoming wedding and granted the late check out without missing a beat. I love Hampton Inns!

Reviews.Title: “Place is fine, but make sure you're not next to ice machine room”
Reviews.Author: Southside
Reviews.Content: No idea why this place has the name Tropicana in it. Anyway, it was fine in terms of room comfort, free airport shuttle, staff, etc., EXCEPT for my room (600) being right next door to a very loud ice machine. Even with ear plugs, it interrupted my sleep. I would nevertheless go back, but would make sure my room is in a different location in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms and close enough to everything.”
Reviews.Author: sklovlady
Reviews.Content: If gambling and glitz aren't your thing, then this was a beautiful place to stay. The staff was friendly and the rooms were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality off strip hotel”
Reviews.Author: RC62Edmonton
Reviews.Content: Our flight was cancelled and we were put up at the Hampton Inn Tropicana until our flight the next day. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean, and the bathroom was fairly modern. There is no restaurant, but there are fast food restaurants close by, and they do provide a buffet breakfast in the morning, but we had to leave too early to take advantage of it. The hotel is not that close to the strip, about 1/4 mile, but they do run a shuttle bus every hour. They do have free internet connect, something you have to pay for on the strip. It is a nice quiet hotel , and one i would consider for any future trips to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Restful escape from the Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: operafanTexas
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff (thank you Susan). The shuttle is great (thank you Tony). Clean rooms, comfortable beds...no smoke anywhere! The free shuttle is just a few minutes to the action on the strip. Cozy, friendly atmosphere. Breakfast buffet is everything and then some! This was my first time to Vegas....I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Super Nice Place - Typical Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: rockmorejohn
Reviews.Content: I stay at Hampton Inn's all over the U.S. and, usually stay at Hampton Inn Tropicana six (6) or more times a year on business travels. And, this place has never let me down. The pool is awesome, the beds are comfy, service is top-notch, and the breakfast is the same as any Hampton Inn (above average). Location is ideal for business or travel, just off the strip and major highway. To be honest, I should keep this well-kept-secret to myself and not post this review, (which will help availability on my next check-in) but, I believe the hotel deserves praise for its investment and diligence. And, after reading some of the posting below, I am appalled.

Reviews.Title: “Decent and comfortable, for a decent and comfortable price”
Reviews.Author: hemingray55
Reviews.Content: The pictures make this property look a little more posh than it is, but it's clean and comfortable with a great staff. I enjoyed staying here for a business trip - it was perfect for this kind of trip. It's just across the freeway from the strip and has easy access to the big hotels just by following Tropicana. It's about a mile from Palms and Rio, and is a short drive to the rental car center by following Dean Martin Dr. to Warm Springs Rd, then across the freeway - no need to drive I-15 at rush hour either. The hotel has a small bar and lounge - convenient for unwinding right at the hotel before retiring to the room. The room is reliably economy Hampton Inn - but is clean, well, furnished, and comfortable. I found the bed was especially good - I would give them an A+ for the bed and bedding. Free internet, though wired, was an excellent amenity. All-in-all, the perfect place for a business trip where affordability matters.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Spclassy
Reviews.Content: Great value for the price. Renewed rooms, great bed, beatuful and clean decoration, great continental breakfast (if you wake up early) , good staff. Closer to the Strip. I loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice amenities, but some of the staff need to go”
Reviews.Author: Webatl
Reviews.Content: The hotel has quite a few nice upscale amenities. Modern, yet warm and comfortable decor. The staff though is hit or miss.
