Some are enthusiastic, others need to find another employer. Getting pool towels should not be so difficult. Getting two doubles versus a king also should not be difficult when the hotel is clearly not full. Lots of potential, but needs to weed out some of the staff who pull everything else down.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, location, room and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: pedeny
Reviews.Content: Hotel while not on the strip was very close. We had rented a car - parking was free and convenient. We used the car to go to the casinos on the strip where valet parking is free - just whatever you tip the valet. Driving was a little crazy. Hotel was very attractive, pool area very relaxing, free breakfast very good - staff kept replenishing the food as there was a crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Decently remodeled rooms; poor service; horrid breakfast”
Reviews.Author: DenverBrian
Reviews.Content: This Hampton Inn is larger in scale than most, with a separate conference center that I didn't have a chance to peek into. We were greeted reasonably but with a focus on efficiency rather than warmth, and placed in a third floor room. Renovations were done about a year ago and the rooms have a warm, semi-tropical vibe with yellow walls and bright orange accents in curtains and furniture. New lamp fixtures are kind of retro in appearance - I think my mom had some of these triple-glass-globe lamps in our house in 1977, or maybe I just saw them on a Brady Bunch episode. I don't expect they'll hold up fashionably for very long. Carpets are light and show stains - and there were some in both rooms we stayed in. Possibly in keeping with the retro theme, the TVs were NOT renovated with the other hard goods and remain a 25" boob tube with perhaps 15 available channels - a definite disappointment. HSIA is free but wired-only in rooms; if you can snag a room overlooking the pool, you might be able to use the wireless signal from there. Beds are Hampton standard and can get warm, especially if you have a balky AC unit as we suffered during our first night. The AC units are old-style through-the-wall PTAC units under the smallish window in the room, and during our first night, the compressor was even noisier than these units are known for - plus, it would not cool the room below about 70. We requested service on the unit the next morning and it was swapped out with another unit with digital controls...which promptly performed a compressor on/off cycle that could only be described as 30 seconds of "chuffing." This supposedly new unit was loud and even more unable to hold temperature - after an hour in the room with the digital thermostat set at 60, the room was about 75 degrees. We requested further service and were told that we had received the one and only replacement AC unit available for a 300-room property. However, they did have another room available so we packed everything up and moved down the hall. Luckily, this PTAC unit operated quietly and efficiently. Beware of the poor maintenance budget, however. The poor maintenance extended to hallways, where the year-old "new" carpet looked like it hadn't been cleaned in five. Then there was breakfast - never a Hampton Inn highlight, and in this case particularly downmarket. Each day of our stay a large tray of biscuits was presented - with absolutely nothing to cover them with. Someone needs to inform the staff that biscuits are usually half of "biscuits and gravy" at a "free breakfast" venue. The egg "circles" were watery and flavorless; the sausage patties about 70% fat. It appears the management is providing exactly the bare minimum needed to keep the franchise flag with the breakfast offerings. Overall, I still rated the property average because their rates were excellent over the Labor Day holiday - $58 on AAA rate. At anything approaching "rack" rate, I wouldn't recommend the property to anyone. If you can find a deal, just beware of the poor maintenance, average-to-cool service, and abysmal breakfast selection.

Reviews.Title: “Yet another great Hampton”
Reviews.Author: cocolinu
Reviews.Content: Overall a great, comfy, clean hotel with a great view and a very nice, accommodating staff (they changed our room to get away form noisy neighbors and provided a fridge in our king room at no extra charge (given that king rooms do not have, by default, fridges or microwaves). Also withing reasonable walking distance from the strip (but hey, there are taxis and the hotel does have a shuttle). Another +: non-smoking rooms and no casino on site. A couple of main issues bothered us however: First, one morning we found a huge palmetto bug in our washroom. By the looks of it, it must have came in with the morning newspaper (as they place it outside the door). Second, the pool was not warm at all, which is surprising when there are 103 degrees outside. We did however enjoy it as it was . Third, they forgot to mention that the shuttle will only drop you off on the strip at the New York New York hotel, and not farther, and will also not pick you up, so you either walk back or take a taxi (only reasonable option at 12am). Fourth, the walls are paper thin. On our first night, we dealt with VERY noisy neighbors. A call to the front desk at 4am slightly fixed the problem, but to avoid that from happening again, we asked to change rooms the next day and our wish was granted. Lastly, the maids didn't replace our empty Kleenex box for the last two days of our stay. All in all, we weren't extremely bothered by these problems as they were compensated by the above + aspects, therefore we won't hesitate to come back if the rates are once again reasonable. (on average 60$/ night)

Reviews.Title: “a bit off from the famed Vegas Strip..”
Reviews.Author: thewanderer-nammo
Reviews.Content: only glitch with this hotel is that its a bit off from the famed Vegas strip.. but the drive to the strip is not more than 5 minutes.. take my word for it.. there are hundreds of casino cum hotels on the strip and i beleive in a similar price one can get a room in those hotels as well.. but before jumping onto this conclusion let me apprise you folks of the advantages this offers.. perfect smile greets you at the front desk.. rooms are very very spacious.. complimentary internet and lavish breakfast buffet are some of the other pro's.. has a decent pool with plentiful of pool shacks besides.. provides free shuttle service to the strip.. also in a similar price.. rooms in those casino cum hotels on the strip would be the cheapest one's and thus wont offer so much on platter.. thus if you have a car then this one is a perfect n better bet.. u wont regret for sure..

Reviews.Title: “Short But Sweet”
Reviews.Author: TCBinKC
Reviews.Content: We stayed our last night here and the location is good for off Strip. Staff was excellent, allowed us to check in early as we came from another property and arrived early. They put us in what appeared to be a suite, it was great! Room was big , clean and comfortable. Breakfast was the usual hot and cold selections typical of a Hampton property. We were not in our room but for a few hours to sleep and fly out the next day. We will stay here again, we had a good experience. I can not comment on the rate as I used my Hilton Rewards free night. They do have a free shuttle to the Strip and the Airport. The New York New York and MGM Grand are close, you could walk if you wanted to however it is a busy street and passes over/ubder I-15.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hampton Inn, But Why Stay Here?”
Reviews.Author: grobma
Reviews.Content: As far as Hampton Inns go, this one was average. That is to say, it provided everything I would expect from a Hampton Inn - good bedding, good value, free wi-fi, continental breakfast with one hot item, etc. Great hot water and water pressure. The bar seemed quite nice and there is a smallish pool. The staff did not seem particularly enthusiastic or friendly which I found to be atypical of the brand. I was here for a conference that was being held at the hotel. I would never otherwise have chosen to stay at this location (due to location - not the hotel itself). If you're in Vegas, why not stay on the strip, especially since rooms at nice strip hotels could be had for the same rate or less? There were a lot of Europeans at the hotel and some families. The hotel runs a free shuttle both to the airport and to the strip with stops at Mandalay Bay and New York, NY. The strip itself is about a 10-15 minute walk from the hotel, crossing I-15. There is an In 'N Out Burger across the street from the hotel and mini-mart at the gas station next door has a little bit of everything you might need.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Weekend”
Reviews.Author: mothercarlson
Reviews.Content: Our daughter was getting married at Caesars Place and we needed to find a reasonable hotel, off the strip, for us coming from MN as well as the other out-of-town guests. Upon arrival, we received great service with a friendly staff. We had 4 rooms, 2 of them were ready before checkin time . This was great because we had lots of luggage and things to get ready for the Wedding on Saturday (4/18). It had only been about an hour when the other rooms were available. We had cars so we did not experience the shuttle service however, in speaking with those that did, due to economic times, the prior was for airport runs before dropping off at the strip so there were times customers had to wait to go to the strip. But...if you don't mind walking, it's about a 20 minute walk to New York, New York. Then I recommend buying the $7.00 DUECE bus which is good for 24 hours that goes the entire strip PLUS to downtown freemont street. They run about every 15 minutes. It was wonderful to come back to the hotel and not have all the noise & smoke of a casino. We were able to sit in the lounge area and vist with everyone in a very comfortable atmosphere. If your purpose to Vegas is for gambling only and want the experience of the night life and action, I would not recommend this hotel. However, if you do want the action but come back to quiet, I highly recommend this hotel. They do have a few poker slots at the bar (which my husband did win at) and a couple slots machines, so you can get a bit of the action there. The hot continental breakfast were wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great place near the Strip”
Reviews.Author: IowaFloridaTraveler
Reviews.Content: The room was large, clean and well furnished. The breakfast was great. And the price was right! This is an ideal place to stay if you don't want a casino hotel. It is close to the Strip and the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed!”
Reviews.Author: abraddock
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable hotel just away from main strip in Las vegas. Very nice comfortable room, friendly staff, lovely pool and access to pc and internet. Ideal for our 1 night stop.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Paris!”
Reviews.Author: tatyanna
Reviews.Content: This is the hotel we were sent to by the airline when our flight was cancelled. This is one place I would recommend to anyone going to Vegas. It is off the strip but it was better than our stay at the Paris!! Great staff...had a great time in the bar & the bartender was excellent, the best we've come in contact with on any of our trips.

Reviews.Title: “You'd be better off at another hotel - I would not recommend it”
Reviews.Author: LisainAZ
Reviews.Content: My sister, a friend and I stayed at the Hampton Inn in Las Vegas for the 4th of July weekend 2008. I chose the Hampton Inn because of its reputation and location. I was disappointed and left the second night to stay at another hotel - the Stratosphere. When I made the reservation I called and requested a renovated room with the flat screen tvs and double beds and was told as long as I typed it in the reservation and I called the day before that I would more than likely be accomodated with a room. After calling the dayt before arrival and then arriving I was told they only have 4 renovated rooms and they were King size only not doubles and they were already taken but to try early the following morning at which I did and was told they could not accomodate me as the rooms were already taken...even when someone just checked in and were given the room ahead of me. The bathroom was nice as well as the free breakfast and the pool was beautiful, however the hotel was older than I expected and the room was small. The beds were comfy but small, they said they were doubles but when I looked at the mattress and the frame they looked more like twins and were different sizes as the frame was larger than the mattress. The shuttle service was accomodating but not free as stated as the driver asked for $5.00. Our A/C in our room did not work properly and our room was really hot, when we called the front desk they asked us to wait a few hours for the room to cool down and mentioned that they do not keep the a/c on in the room before a customer arrives....they said they open the windows to let the air in which is really just the heat (which was over 110 that weekend) into the room? Hours later we came back and the room was just as hot but then the front desk mentioned they were sold out and we sweat all night until we were finally able to move to another room the next day. The location is across the freeway from the strip near the MGM, Mandolay Bay, and other attractions but not close enough to walk to. I travel alot for work and am very familiar with all the hotel brands, services, and accomodations each brand provides and I was very disappointed in my stay at this Hampton...overall I would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: taffy2001
Reviews.Content: I stay at Hamptons frequently for business, but this was a vacation trip and this Hampton was the best I have stayed at. Most importantly, the staff was incredible! They went above and beyond when our friend got sick. They didn't call him a cab, but they took him to the clinic in the shuttle. The staff was very polite, friendly and knowledgable about the area and recommendations. They have a two key safe deposit box system, instead of the in room safes or the one large safe in the office. We felt very comfortable leaving valuables in the safe deposit box. The room was clean and comfortable. With the typical Hampton Inn beds and pillows, it was a good night sleep. The bar was nicely stocked and had a larger variety than most hotel bars. And we were allowed to take the drinks out to the pool. The pool was decent sized, with a waterfall and a hot tub. Lots of seating and lounge chairs were available. And the pool towels were not the normal 3 foot long towels, they were the big beach towels. The location is great. About a 5 minute easy walk to the strip. And for the price, you can't beat it. The continental breakfast was also better than normal and had all sorts of variety. Parking was free and there was plenty of spaces available, and they also had a parking garage for the busy times. The only downfall was the business center. There were 2 computers there, but only one worked and that monitor was having problems. Overall, I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maroto
Reviews.Content: Wasn't sure what to expect in Las Vegas, but after a 10hr flight from London, this hotel was fantastic and we would definitely recommend it and stay there again. Staff were courteous and helpful. Booked two rooms for 3 nights, one for my husband and our 11yr old son and one for our 19 and 17 yrs old sons. Both were bright, clean and comfortable. Excellent free wireless high speed internet. Breakfast were more than adequate offering an excellent choice, and the breakfast area was clean and inviting. Complimentary coffee available all day. Close enough to the Strip and although close to the I15, we had no traffic noise and great views of the Excaliber and New York New York at night!! Can't find anything to complain about - a great hotel. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice for an off-the-strip stay”
Reviews.Author: travelingstar55
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. It is a typical Hampton Inn. The beds were very comfortable, room nice and clean and bright. The staff was courteous but sometimes so busy it took a while to get help. As a side note our friends were staying at the MGM and our room looked just like theirs except they had about 50 square feet more room than we did. They offer a free shuttle to and from airport. This is a plus and saves about $16. Our shuttle drivers were fabulous! They will shuttle you TO but not from several casinos on the strip for free (we always tipped however). We were told we could walk to the strip, which is true. However, the walk will take you under the interstate overpass right off the Excaliber parking lot. There were numerous homeless folks there and we were not comfortable carrying large amounts of cash while strolling thru there. We were advised not to walk it at night. We ended up taking the shuttle to the strip and bringing a cab back, which averages about $10 before tip. Breakfasts were typical Hampton Inn style. Good selection of fruit, muffins, bagels, cereals, etc. Eggs were pre-cooked or one morning they had breakfast pizza's. The shuttle driver had told us about the place across the street for breakfast and said it was good. So we took our lives in our hands one morning and took a hair-raising walk across the street to the Wild West Gambling Hall and Hotel for their $2.99 breakfast. Breakfast was good but it was so smokey that the air just hung like a blue fog. Unless you are desperate for a change of pace for breakfast I would not recommend it. Overall, if I cannot stay on the strip I would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “nasty desk workers”
Reviews.Author: georgiadrew
Reviews.Content: The check in people promised shuttle service, but then backed out on it and we had to take a cab. The bus shuttle driver was nasty and rude, and gave guests a lot of bad-attitude!

Reviews.Title: “Suitable Location Off The Strip”
Reviews.Author: annieontheroad
Reviews.Content: Booked the Hampton Inn for a conference held at the Mandalay Bay as other hotel was over my budget and overbooked. Hampton was only 1 mile or so away from the Strip, which was convenient. I drove from CA but if I didn't have transportation, the hotel offered THE speediest shuttle service (one way only) to and from the airport and other locations on the Strip. Complimentary breakfast (wide offering from healthy fruit and more delicious bacon & eggs etc), complimentary internet, complimentary amenities in case you forgot them (toothbrush, razor, conditioner and the like). Comfortable and clean with courteous staff; couldn't ask for anything more. Added bonuses: even though the hotel is near the airport (the older "Fabulous Vegas" sign is close by), my room--facing a rather isolated street--was relatively quiet from street noise. Also - try a drive down Frank Sinatra Dr or Polaris for a good night view of the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice option to staying on the strip”
Reviews.Author: lovedintexas
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 1 night at the Hampton Inn due to being bumped off our flight out of Vegas. This hotel is across the freeway from the strip, but you can walk to the NYNY casino easily. They also offer a free shuttle to and from the airport, as well as a shuttle to 3 stops along the strip. However, you are responsible for getting home from the strip, and as you know, cabs aren't cheap in Vegas (but what is)! They offered complimentary breakfast and have a nice bar area in the lobby, which stays open until 2 or 3. The rooms are nice, very standard, and the beds are quite comfortable. If you are looking for a less expensive option than staying directly on the strip, this is a hotel I would reccomend. Also, they appeared to be able to accomodate conferences which is nice for business meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Great for off Strip....”
Reviews.Author: LLoeb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn Tropicana from the 4th of Feb through the 8th. It was nicer than I had expected the hotel to be, the comp. breakfast was decent, hot coffee, tea, cereal, eggs w/ham, or bagels with melted cheese, bacon & eggs, lots of other goodies. The pool area is quite spacious. The shuttle to the strip is a bonus, to get back you'll need to either take a cab or walk ,if your single females I recommend getting a cab back, a little scary walking back especially at night. The cab from Harrahs cost us around $13 + tip. You will not have a problem getting a cab. Go over to any of the major Hotels and you'll see them lined up everywhere. The staff are all pleasant, rooms are CLEAN, beds are super comfy. Only downside if your a smoker, it's tough to get a smoking room, you'll have to suffer and go outside. No big deal! Great experience! All remodeled. Gas station right next door if you need anything, As is a Jack in the Box & In N Out Burger

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: marygc36
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hampton Inn after accumulating points for a free stay- we are big Hilton fans. While this hotel is just off The Strip, we thought we'd give it a try. The walk to the Strip takes 10 minutes tops, and you have to cross traffic, go over overpasses and under overpasses but a free shuttle is provided to the Strip. (No return shuttle though). That is the ONLY negative- the place is awesome! The staff was actually quite fun and always very helpful and friendly. The room was spectacular- the best I've ever seen for a Hampton Inn. The decor was beautiful and we had a nice view overlooking the pool area. The morning hot breakfast had plenty to choose from and varied a little bit each day so whether you want eggs and sausage, or biscuits and gravy and a donut or just want something healthy like yogurt, fresh fruit and wheat toast- you will be taken care of. There is a bar that was open even late at night when we returned from "touring" and the pool and outdoor hot tub is beautiful- towels right there for you and big comfortable chaise lounges with big, soft cushions. We went out one evening and had the place to ourselves- it's open til 10:00 pm, I believe, and is very private. (The surrounding area doesn't have the "manicured development" of The Strip). There is also an In and Out Burger across the street- which really hit the spot late one night! I would definitely recommend this hotel if you don't mind a bit of a walk to the main drag- gotta burn off those calories somehow!!

Reviews.Title: “Great little gem in Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: degreemd
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent alternative to a strip hotel. The Hamptons are an excellent value and seem very updated. This one was clean, friendly, festive, and seemed safe. The room was a little small, but nice and comfy. Cloud 9 bed, free bottled water, and a great breakfast. I think the shuttle goes to the strip? But I don't know for sure. Also, I had to wait at the airport for almost 25 minutes for the shuttle and then when he arrived we sat another 15 minutes - felt long that late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas, Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Toutpartout
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Vegas - was there for a wedding. Spent 2 days at the Hampton Inn Tropicana and was pleasantly surprised. For the rates, I was pleasantly suprised as the decor was really good and the room was really big with all the ammenities- internet/cable tv/ heating/air con/ bathroom with shower/tub. the hotel lobbu is comfy and chic. There are multiple lifts and the rooms are clean and very well appointed. It is very busy and theflight crews from airlines stay there. Location- the hotel is about 10 mins from MacCarran Airport and 10 mins from the strip. A shuttle bus is provided free of charge and it runs around every 20 mins although once we were kept waiting for 45 min because of a problem with the bus. the shuttle goes to and from the airport from and to the hotel BUT only from the hotel to the main road in LAs vegas ( known as 'the strip'). There is a business centre with 2 computers internet access and 3 printers and it is free of charge. There is no time limit and there is stationery, Fed-Ex/ UPS forms/envelopes. The only down side is the complimentary breakfast which is not too great. The huge concentration of hotels in Las Vegas on the main road known as 'the strip ' is accessible via the hotel shuttle or via taxi for around USD $9-10. You cannot hail taxis in Vegas, you have to go the the taxi posts in most hotels and wait there- the queues can be long but they move fast.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel & Service”
Reviews.Author: lauren2579
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and the beds were very comfortable. The best hotel we stayed at during our 8 day trip. We stayed 2 nights here and it is convenient to the strip. The shuttle bus drivers are very pleasant and helpful. The breakfast was good and the staff was attentive. We had a great stay and I recommend this hotel to anyone looking for somewhere a little off the strip but still close. My 10 year old daughter was with me so it was nice to NOT have to walk half a mile through a casino to get to our room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay!”
Reviews.Author: PedroNeves
Reviews.Content: I booked a king size bed and when we arrived only 2 Queen size bedrooms were available. I tried to change but no other room was available!Staff didn't care about it and argued saying it was a hotels.com problem!Great Breakfast!Free Parking!Great Pool!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Close to Strip, Great Pool!”
Reviews.Author: MrHSCounselor
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for two nights. The room was clean, and the hotel staff VERY helpful. The continental breakfast was exactly what I expected for the price of the room, not much but the kids liked it and my wife and I liked not having to spend extra. The outside air temperature was over 115 degrees both days we were there and the pool was perfect. Lots of cable channels for the kids to watch. Close enough to the strip that mom and dad could drive there in a few minutes. The hotel felt safe enough to leave the kids (12 and 16) in the pool and room for a few hours in the evening while the parents went the strip. We asked about a good, inexpensive buffet for a late lunch and got a GREAT referral to the Silverton Resort, about a 15 minuted drive south of the strip. We will look at Hampton properties in the years to come!

Reviews.Title: “OK for a short trip - worked from room”
Reviews.Author: tester223
Reviews.Content: I accompanied my girlfriend on a business trip. She went to work during the day while i worked from the hotel room. Not sure what happened to the wireless internet, but there was free wired internet ( not a bad thing but i remained tethered to the desk ). internet speeds were actually quite good for a hotel, something along the lines of what you'd get from a 1.5meg dsl line. I had no problems with it at all. The bed was huge and very comfortable ( pitty there was no wireless or i'd have remained there all day ). The staff were pleasant and dealt with any requests quickly ( the phone needed a quick fix upon arrival, but was up and running in 10 minutes of me making the call). If you want peace and quiet then don't stay at the front of the hotel, the road out front is very busy. The hotel was under renovation, floor 3 was gutted, and floor 4 wasn't far behind. However there was little noise from the construction ... maybe the road drowned it out ?? Walk into NYNY/MGM was 10-15 minutes, and the shuttle took you to the strip ever 15 minutes for free if you were feeling lazy. Though we were told that is wouldn't bring you back ..... not a problem - taxi only $6-8. Location was not a problem for us ... besides there was an in and out burger across the road. In summary the hotel was fine, i managed to spend hours in the room working each day and didn't have any problems.

Reviews.Title: “Not What I'd Expect from Hampton”
Reviews.Author: KatKnapTrvl
Reviews.Content: Airlines booked us here after our flight was canceled. Although we did not have a choice of hotels, we do happen to like this chain. BUT...this wasn't like other Hampton Inns. It seems to be a fairly new hotel, or recently refurbished, but hasn't been well maintained at all. The staff was great--pleasant, trying to accomodate everyone, and very honest when asked which nearby restaurants were good. (Wild-Wild-West restaurant had good recommendation from the hotel staff as well as other guests who had been on our flight.) In fact, the hotel staff was probably the best thing about this hotel. There were no non-smoking rooms available, so our room was most definitely a "smoking room." The carpet was damp for some reason, and I don't think it was from carpet shampoo. There was food on the floor on the far wall where a table and two chairs sat. Housekeeping probably forgot to vacuum there. And also forgot to bend down and manually pick up the food. But the bedding was clean, and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom was fairly clean, hot water, plenty of towels, and a coffee pot. And the hotel was very quiet. There was also a roach in the room, on the wall. One of the other reviewers said he/she was told roaches are normal for Las Vegas. Maybe so, but I've never noticed a roach in any of the 4* and 5* hotels on the strip. Although we didn't use the pool, our room did have a pool view. The pool looked clean from what I could see, and it seemed like an adequate pool area, and was being enjoyed by several kids and teens. If you want something that is not on the Strip, but within walking distance, this is probably adequate, although I would not recommend walking or jogging in this area at night. At 5am, waiting to take the shuttle back to the airport, there was quite a bit of foot-traffic from the Golden Palms Hotel across the street to Tropicana Avenue, all wearing very short skirts, skimpy tops, and very high heels. I'm pretty certain they weren't registered guests of the Golden Palm, either. They appeared to be women who worked at the Golden Palm, but were not employed there. But they only crossed through the Hampton parking lot without approaching the door. Perhaps because there was a security person at the Hampton lobby door. The hotel provides a complimentary shuttle to NYNY, MGM, and TI (to return to the hotel, you'll need to get a cab or walk back.) If you are a female traveling alone, I would not recommend this side of I-15. I would not feel safe here alone. As I said, we were booked here by the airlines, so our room was free. Otherwise, I probably would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Above avg Hampton”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Seemed a new rehab. Nice for Hampton / above avg for that chain due to newness of rooms + standard HI decor. Suspect that previous neg. reviews were prior to a renovation. Location is convenient / near airport + fwy. West of Excalibur on Tropicana. Not for weekenders walking to strip, very convenient for business trip. Nice to be just south of strip congestion. Tacky: Property charges for use of business center. Charge for web browsing, charge for printing. Frequent travelers expect better from typical Hampton.

HotelInfo.Name: Hampton Inn Tropicana
HotelInfo.Address: 4975 Dean Martin Drive, Las Vegas, NV 89118-1655
